utterances.utterance: Stay tuned for more hurricane updates throughout the hour and throughout the night here on Fox. We'll take you live to the coastal regions that are already feeling the effects of Florence. It's happening now. But first tonight, Democrats are powerless to stop Brett Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nomination on their own. That's the math of the question. But they're still trying and they're going to keep trying apparently till the bitter end. In a last minute twist today, Senator Dianne Feinstein of California says she has sent a letter about Kavanaugh to the FBI. It's a secret letter written by a secret person containing a secret allegation about possible misconduct in high school some 35-plus years ago. That's what we know. Trace Gallagher has more. Hey, Trace.

utterances.speaker: TRACE GALLAGHER, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: Hi, Tucker. Senator Feinstein released a statement saying the reason she won't talk about the information she passed on to federal investigators is because quoting here "That individual strongly requested confidentiality, declined to come forward or press the matter further, and I have honored that decision." The New York Times is reporting the matter involves possible sexual misconduct between Kavanaugh and a female when the judge was in high school. Fox News has learned that Senator Feinstein first heard about the claim back in July. And yet, during 65 meetings with senators, including Feinstein, more than 32 hours of confirmation hearings, and 1,278 written follow-up questions from Democrats to Kavanaugh, the matter was never raised until today when Senator Feinstein sent it to investigators. The FBI says it will include the information in Kavanaugh's background file but were (ph) told any further action on the letter would have to come from the White House. So far, the White House has done nothing except call this a Democratic delay tactic. John Cornyn, the number two Republican in the Senate and Member of the Judiciary Committee is incredulous saying "Let me get this straight. This is a statement about a secret letter regarding a secret matter and an unidentified person. Right." The conservative Judicial Crisis Network says "This has all the indications of an 11th hour character assassination." We should note Democrats on the Judiciary Committee have also tried and failed to subpoena documents into Kavanaugh's time as a top White House aide to George W. Bush, including documents on Kavanaugh's knowledge of enhanced interrogations and warrantless wiretapping in the wake of 9/11. Judiciary Committee Chair, Chuck Grassley, who has not yet seen the letter from Senator Feinstein, says the confirmation vote will go forward as scheduled, September 20th. Tucker?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Trace Gallagher, thanks a lot for that summary. Author and columnist Mark Steyn has been following this too. And he joins us tonight. So Mark, typically you'd want to withhold judgment on something like this because you don't know what's in the letter.

utterances.speaker: MARK STEYN, STEYNONLINE.COM
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: But here's what we do know. Judge Kavanaugh went to high school at Georgetown Prep in Bethesda, Maryland. If there was a crime alleged 35 years later, presumably, that would be referred to the Maryland State Police, with the local police in Bethesda. Instead, Senator Feinstein sent it to the FBI. Federal authorities would have no obvious jurisdiction.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So that tells me right there that this is a crock and it's the worst kind of smear, a smear you can't rebut against a man with a wife and small children. I'm not sure I've seen anything lower ever.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: No. You're absolutely right there. As you say, the FBI has no obvious jurisdiction here. I - I think in the normal course of events given that this is something to do with the Junior Prom in Maryland in 1981 or 1979 or whenever the hell it was, it would be going to juvenile court. So this would be the first United States Supreme Court justice to be tried in juvenile court. I don't - that's a - that's a legal fuzz. I think what we have here is actually the equivalent of what happened when Comey briefed the President on the so-called Steele dossier about Russian hookers in his hotel room--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: --and all the rest of it. And that gave the pretext to the media because Comey then leaked news of the meeting that gave the media a pretext to discuss the dossier. Likewise, Senator Feinstein releasing, as everyone said, the secret letter from a secret person about a secret matter about the high school prom has now given cover for a - a lot of sexual allegations. We don't know what they are. They were - they were half a lifetime ago. And as you say, it's not something that he can be rebutted. And I think and - and the real battle here, Tucker, is actually between Dianne Feinstein and the new Left. They were disappointed--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Right. Exactly.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: --by the big shot Democrat dinosaurs' performance in the hearing rooms and they want something a little more Antifa, a little more Black Lives Matter--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: That is so true.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: --a little more Bernie Sanders. And it's pathetic to see Dianne Feinstein, and I've no - I've no idea what she did at her high school prom however many years ago that was. It's pathetic to see Dianne Feinstein reduce to this.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Well it's disgusting. And the dynamic you describe is exactly what's happening. The dinosaurs who were on their way out in charge of that party are terrified and they're responding to them up. Let me ask you a question that seems reasonable to me, it'll probably spark protests against me, somehow. But and I don't know what the allegation is and I'm prepared to withhold judgment on that. But a 35-year old allegation, if it exists, that has never been reported to the police doesn't that at least raise the question of why is it never been reported assuming it hasn't been?

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's actually I think it's - I think it's wrong to go back and - and re-litigate a past you didn't litigate at the time. I think that's very, very dangerous. You see that as part of this moral panic that is going on over the Me Too things. I mean if you - if you go back to the nearest comparable thing, the Clarence Thomas business--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: --that was within the previous decade. We're - we're talking about something that was never - I mean what - the only reassuring thing about this is that as you know, investigations are interminable in this country and in--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: --Washington, in particular. And the only good thing about this is that the FBI has looked at it and kicked it out of their purview in 10 minutes flat. And good for them, they're not opening an investigation. They've just given it to the White House. They don't want to touch this. She's just collude - she's just diminished her own reputation by participating in this smear.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I've never met Brett Kavanaugh. I have no personal stake in this whatsoever. But I don't - honestly, I think that any normal person should be offended by this. This is too much. It's too low. It's disgusting.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Oh absolutely - absolutely, it's--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: It's unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: STEYN

utterances.utterance: Well after many months of waiting, we're finally welcoming Stormy Daniels' lawyer on to the show, on to the set, actually. Right here, he'll be joining us in just a moment. Obviously, all night, we'll be watching the Hurricane Florence as it slams into North Carolina. We'll have updates on that throughout the night.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: This is Fox News Alert: ABC is reporting tonight that former Donald Trump campaign manager Paul Manafort has tentatively agreed to a plea deal with the special counsel, Robert Mueller. If that's true that deal would head off Manafort's upcoming trial in Washington. He's being tried on charges of fraud and, hilariously, failing to register as a foreign agent. We'll, of course, continue to follow it as updates appear. But in other news today, just days ago, Peter Strzok's attorney tried to claim that the text messages that Strzok sent to his girlfriend Lisa Page about a "Media leaking strategy" were actually evidence he was trying to stop leaks. utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: No, no, we can't be but--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: No, no, listen--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Based on what you just heard?

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: Yes, I mean, you know, Page and Strzok had a relationship that we can all agree was inappropriate. That shouldn't have happened. But to take that relationship - first of all, it's very flimsy to suggest that they were somehow trying to initiate or corrupt the Trump Administration or the Trump investigation--

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: --but also - also - but I would also say--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --I'm not just - I'm just saying they were leaking to the press.

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: No, no he - he doesn't--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: He says it in his text.

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: That's very unclear. But I would also suggest that--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Well wait, wait, wait, hold on, he just says The New York Times is mad because--

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: --wait, wait, wait, no, that's not - that's not what he says.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --The Washington Post does (ph).

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY

utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.utterance: We don't know that. He doesn't--

utterances.utterance: We don't know that. We don't know who--

utterances.utterance: It's not things we heard around town.

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: We don't know that--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON

utterances.speaker: CARLSON

utterances.speaker: CARLSON

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: I'm not at all. But what I'm--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: What I'm suggesting is--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: All I'm saying is--

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: --whatsoever, yes.

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: I'll tell you--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: Here - here - here's what--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: It doesn't sound like you do.

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: You know what? You know what? I am so glad that we have Inspector General Michael Horowitz on the case because he is looking--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: But why aren't you made about it?

utterances.utterance: He is--

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: Michael - Michael--

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: What? No, no, no, but how about this?

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: Tucker, let me (ph)--

utterances.utterance: I'm going to leave you on this question.

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: No, here's the thing. Let me just finish the sentence. I am very happy that the United States Inspector General is looking into--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes, OK. I've lived here too long.

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: Carter Page and Michael (ph)--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I'm not--

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: That's a great thing.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I guess it's not right--

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: And he is going to answer it.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --look, I want an answer.

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: I did not. I did not (ph)--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: --I'm happy that it's being investigated.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: Mm-hmm.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON

utterances.utterance: --we should have--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --obvious suggestion that they were in Peter Strzok's admission that he was (ph).

utterances.speaker: CARLSON

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: While he was an agent, yes.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes, OK, glad maybe that will prove it.

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: That maybe (ph)--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON

utterances.speaker: CALLOWAY
utterances.utterance: Good to see you, Tucker.

utterances.utterance: Thank you. Michael Moore is a crusader for the average American. He's told you that countless times. But in business, according to people who work with him, he acts more like the robber barons he denounces. What is that? Greg Gutfeld will unravel that mystery. Plus, after that, our long-awaited interview with Stormy Daniels' lawyer who joins us on set, just ahead.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Well here's an odd story we thought we'd tell you about. A week ago today, last Thursday, with no warning, federal authorities swooped into something called the National Solar Observatory. It's in Sunspot, New Mexico right above the Mexican border and they evacuated the premises. It's a - it's federal facility. There's a post office next door to the Observatory and they shut that down too. Local residents watched all that. They saw at least one Black Hawk helicopter, for real, circling the site. The local sheriff told reporters that the FBI refused to explain any of what was happening to him. "For the FBI to get involved that quick and be so secretive about it, there was a lot of stuff going on up there." Huh? What stuff? Well we asked. The Feds won't say. But the Observatory today issued a cryptic statement about an unnamed security issue. Now, maybe it's nothing. Maybe, it's something. We're going to keep on it. Find out. American society seems to be fraying at the edges but filmmaker Michael Moore believes he's part of the solution. He is the hero who can help save it. Watch him describe his role earlier this year.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL FRANCIS MOORE, DOCUMENTARY FILMMAKER, LEFT-WING ACTIVIST
utterances.utterance: We must also cleanse our American soul of its White male privilege, its voracious greed, and its enforced ignorance that has made a population of semiliterate and unaware people.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Michael Moore, the soul cleanser. One of the things rotting our soul, he just said, is greed. And yet, many people close to Moore, people who would know say that he himself is Exhibit A for that problem. For example, his film festival has just been sued for allegedly failing to pay vendors, the little people, and instead, smearing them in the press. Meanwhile, Moore's ex-wife says that he stiffed her on the profits from the films she helped produce. Those would include Bowling for Columbine and Fahrenheit 9/11. Greg Gutfeld has long made a passion of studying the career of Michael Moore. He also, of course, hosts "The Five" on Fox as well as "The Greg Gutfeld Show" and he joins us tonight. So, I'm a little confused by this Greg. Michael Moore, one thing we know about him is he's a champion of the people.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So why isn't he championing individual people and, instead, scamming them, they say?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well that - that's where you're wrong. He's a man of the people unless those people are working for him.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Then he will shaft (ph) them to pay for his pies because he loves his pies. You know what - here's the - it's the truth of the activists, Tucker. They think globally but they're jerks locally. The act - the act of caring actually excuses--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --their own obnoxious, self-involved, arrogant behavior. If you ever were in college you know this. You always - if you had a roommate that was an activist, they would go to the peace marches but they would never pay their rent on time. They never spring for the toilet paper. And they always ate your food, Tucker. I'm also worried because Michael Moore is looking more--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: That is so true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --it's true but, you know, Michael Moore is looking more and more like Large Marge from "Pee-wee's Playhouse," the movie, "Pee-wee's Great Adventure." Do you remember Large Marge, the truck driver?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: No, I've missed that. Maybe it is I saw the sequel, maybe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And by the way, he's - you know, he believes that the world's coming to an end. Why is it that people who think they're so brilliant and they think that the world is coming to an end they never bathe or wear fresh underwear?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Well maybe that's why because it's not worth it. But wait--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I'm still sort of confused by this. So, if you really cared about the world and making it better, wouldn't you begin with the people around you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're unimportant, Tucker. They're unimportant because you have a greater mission in life and that is to save the world. Therefore, you could be mean to your wife, you could ignore your kids, you could cheat, you could be terrible. And by the way, Tucker, you're not so perfect yourself. You know what - do you know what yesterday was, Tucker? Do you know what yesterday--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: --Man of The People Tucker, Populist Tucker--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It was my birthday. Did I hear from Tucker Carlson?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes, you did. I texted you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, you didn't.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I said happy 30th birthday. Yes, I did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I waited.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I waited. I was playing our song.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: You lost your--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I wore your favorite shirt.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: You lost your phone in a bar and you know it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Anyway.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So, I'm going to ask you this because you're the perfect person to ask.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Very shortly in this show we're going to speak to Stormy Daniels' attorney in just a few minutes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: If you are sitting in this chair what would you ask him?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would, you know, he's a porn expert. So, I would ask him how do you permanently erase your browser history because I'm always interested in that. That's a question a - a lot of my friends asked me that question. No, here's what I'm complaining. You know, I got nothing against porn. But this is a highly immoral activity that Stormy Daniels is participating in. It's not adult films. It's that she reneged on a deal. She is a - she is a paid sex worker. She gets paid for sex. Isn't that what this is - what is she mad about? I don't understand. What did Trump do? He- -

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Well that--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She's blinking (ph)--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --that's the real question. What is--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --and that's a sincere question, by the way I'm not--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I feel sorry for Stormy Daniels. I think she's being exploited right before (ph)--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, absolutely. Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: But I don't understand what the injury to her was. I'm not being mean.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it's - it's--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Do you know what it was?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's - it's a - it was a deal that they made. And I think it's maybe she's mad that he - she could have gotten more money out of it then she did because he became President. Maybe that's why she's upset. The other sad thing about porn is that no one ever retires.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes, right (ph).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They always try to - the - the whole thing is they try to get out of porn. Everything's about getting - can't be a good vocation if the first goal is to get out of it.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: It's true whereas no one ever wants to get out of television.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, that's true. We're dying.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: But thank you (ph)--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You'll have to carry me out of here on a stretcher.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: You only get fired. That's the only way out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Greg Gutfeld, great to see. Thank you for that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Always a pleasure. And thanks for the gift.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: As we told you, the wait is over. After months of trading barbs on air and online we are going to meet Stormy Daniels' lawyer right here. That's next. And, of course, we're going to continue to keep you updated on the path of Hurricane Florence bearing down on the Carolinas. That's ahead too.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: You may recognize this man. He's a lawyer. He represents the porn actress Stormy Daniels in her lawsuits against the President and Michael Cohen. But in the last six months he has become famous in his own right. He's now one of the most consistent fixtures on cable news in this country. He's appeared on CNN and MSNBC literally hundreds of times but he's moving beyond being a mere television celebrity. He's now talking about running for office for president. He's released his positions on major issues. He's traveled to Iowa, New Hampshire and Michigan and Ohio. He seems serious about it. We've invited him on this show many times to talk about his plans but he's always declined until tonight. He's now agreed to appear on our set provided we give him time to state his case. And we're, of course, happy to do that. In the past, he's also demanded that we stop referring to him by a certain unflattering nickname. We haven't agreed to that demand. But tonight, as a gesture of goodwill, we will not use that nickname because we're always grateful when guests are brave enough to show up in person including in this case and he joins us now. Thanks a lot for coming on.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL JOHN AVENATTI, ATTORNEY
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So, I mean we could sit and hurl insults at each other for the segment, already done that. I've certainly insulted you. You've insulted me. But you seem smart. So, let me take you seriously as someone who wants to be involved in the public conversation and ask you about things that you have said on questions of policy to flush them out a little bit. So this is you at a rally in July, I think it was the day after the President spoke with Vladimir Putin in Helsinki, and you were addressing a rally and here's what you said. Watch.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: What Vladimir Putin and Russia did to this country in connection with the 2016 election is no different than if they would had placed a 100,000 troops on our border.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: This was an invasion. It was an electronic invasion. They used hackers and tweeters to elect this president.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So, if Russia had a 100,000 troops on our border I mean that would be an active war, a profound provocation. What would be the rational response to that if you really felt the threat was that profound? If you were president, how would you respond to that?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Well Tucker, I understood that I was coming on your show tonight to talk about the case involving my client.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Why? I didn't - I didn't tell you that and--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Wait, wait--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --I'm happy to talk about the case. I - but I just played you a clip--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --wait, wait, Tucker, Tucker, Tucker, Tucker, you got to stop--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --I don't - I just asked you--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --Tucker, you got to stop interrupting me, OK, because one of the conditions of me coming on tonight was that you were not going to do what you do routinely to guests with (ph) just talk over them and interrupt them so--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Well--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --just let me finish with my answer, OK?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK. I said I'll give you a fair interview. I just I actually don't have an interest in squabbling with you at all or name-calling. I've done a lot of that to you. And you've done that to me.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Right. But not to, you know, but not to my face.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I could but what's the point? I want to take you seriously. I'm serious.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So, I just played a clip of what you said at a rally. You're traveling to states because you want to influence policy direction.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Correct.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I don't think it's unfair to ask you about something that you said.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: What's the question?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: And the question, let me restate it, is you said that Russia has done something that is equivalent to putting a 100,000 troops on our border. That's an act of war.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Correct.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: And I wonder two things. One, what you would do as president if that happened on your watch? And two, what do you think Russia thinks watching public figures like you say that we're at war with Russia? What effect do you think that has?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Well first of all there's no question that Russia interfered with the 2016 election in a very serious way. The only question is what was the involvement in Donald Trump or by Donald Trump and his cronies in the process? And that's what Bob Mueller's in the process of getting to the bottom of but one of the grant (ph)--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: But how should we as a country respond?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: There you go interrupting me again.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: So, how - how should we respond? We should--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes, I asked you that three times.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --we should respond with the absolute force of the law. We should be doing everything in our power to bring those individuals to justice, those individuals that are also in Russia. And let me tell you what we should not be doing. We should not be standing shoulder to shoulder with Vladimir Putin and choosing Russia over the hard- working men and women of the intelligence community that risk their lives for this country.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: The President has sold out the United States for the benefit of--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK. But the Administration--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --Putin.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --announced today a new round of even tougher sanctions against Russia. Do you support that?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I - I think it's a start but I don't think it's a step--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: What would be the end?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --I don't think it's a step in the right direction. I - I don't think the President has shown any leadership relating to Vladimir - Vladimir--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Sanctions are not a step in the right direction? Want to change (ph)?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --no, I said it is a step.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: But it's not enough.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I believe that President Trump should demand the extradition of each and every individual in Russia that Bob Mueller and others believe were responsible for the election meddling--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK. So remember people have been (ph)--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I think that's - I think that's a--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --they have been charged. OK. This is starting--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --start. I think that's a start.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: But what's - I mean if you really believe that it's the same as a 100,000, what I'm saying is you're using reckless rhetoric on a subject you don't really understand that increases the temperature between the United States and a nuclear-armed adversary. Is that a responsible thing to do?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I think under those circumstances I stand by my words. And I think for you to lecture--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: That it's a 100,000 troops on the border?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I think - I think for you - I think for you to lecture me about reckless rhetoric is rather ironic, Tucker, in light of some of the reckless rhetoric that you engage in--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK. OK. Reckless rhetoric--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --each and every day on this show.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK. So, you've said that you are a civil libertarian in effect. You're a libertarian on sex questions. And that's - that's fine with me. Does it bother you that the Obama Administration authorized spying on American citizens connected to a rival presidential campaign?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Well, first of all, I don't think it's been established that that occurred, number one.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: That Carter Page was spied on?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I - I don't believe that that's been established, number one that in fact President Obama authorized such - such--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: His - his Administration--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Are - are you going to interrupt me for the entire segment or just--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I'm - I'm clarifying because I don't think you understand the question.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: No, I do understand the question.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: The Obama Administration authorized spying an American citizen connected to the Trump campaign. Does that bother you at all?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: First of all, I don't think that's been established. If it was established, of course, it would bother me. Are we going to get to the facts of my client's case? Are we going to get to the--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes, let me just ask you one last--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Are we going to get - are we going to get--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --adult (ph) question first.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: OK, yes.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Because you're traveling around the country--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --as a commentator on politics. And I'm interested to know what you think. I don't think that's illegitimate. So, it has not been established that Carter Page was spied on? Is that what - is that what you're saying?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: How many times are you going to ask me the same question? I've already stated that in my view I don't believe that President Obama has been shown to have authorized the spying quote-unquote on - on--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: The - the Obama Administration, why dodge the question? Look, you traveled here with policy advisors who've worked on other campaigns to the show tonight--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I have no idea. I didn't - I didn't - I didn't--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --I think you'd be (ph) ready for a simple question.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --travel here with policy advisors. Can I ask you - let me ask you a question? Why is it - why is it--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: No, no, thank you. Why don't you get a TV show and then you could ask me a question?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: No, no, why is it that, no - no, why is it that you don't--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I've asked you a simple question. And you're not answering--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --why is it that you don't call--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --the question.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --Donald Trump the creepy porn president? He's the one that had sex with a four month old son at home--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK. So, so now--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --with my client without a condom.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK. So here's - here's the - here's the--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: But - but you don't want to acknowledge that.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Hold on.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You don't want to acknowledge that.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Let me (ph) acknowledge that.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Acknowledge it.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Do you believe that he had sex with my client?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes, I do. I've said that on the air multiple times.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: OK. So, he's lied repeatedly to the American people and you're OK with that.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So let me ask you a question. What is - what is the--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You think it's OK if the President lies to the American people?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Let's - settle down. Let me finish my question to you. What is the crime, the harm, the injury to your client by Donald Trump? As far as I understand this was a consensual sexual relationship. And yes, I believe it occurred. I don't know that. But it seems like it did. I'm willing to believe that it did. But it seemed consensual and then she was paid at the end of it. And yet, you and, by the way, I'm not attacking Stormy Daniels. I feel sorry for here. I feel she's being exploited by you and--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You - you've attacked her for six months.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I feel that you and others are exploiting her, so I feel bad for her. But I'm wondering what the injury is to her.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I think you demean her repeatedly and I think you're--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I think you're a hypocrite because when's the last time--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So let me ask you - let me ask you what the injury--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --I think you're an absolute hypocrite.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --you want to talk about the case. I'm asking you the core question--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --in the case. What is the injury to Stormy Daniels?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: The injury is that the agreement that was entered into was not adhered to by Michael Cohen and Donald Trump. They did not fulfill their end of the bargain. Now, do you want to talk to the - about the injury to the American people--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So, it is lying so you're--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --the lies and the cover (ph)--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --you believe that you believe--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --are you going to continue to interrupt? Yes.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: No, but you just - you just went off on this moral lecture about how it was wrong for the President to have an adulterous affair. And I would agree with that. But you're very outraged. So was your--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I didn't say that.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes, you said.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: It's an injury against the American people that he had sex with someone not--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: No, you didn't let me finish. You didn't let me finish.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --his wife when his wife was pregnant.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: The injury is that he and Michael Cohen and others lied to the American people and covered up the $130,000 payment and violated campaign finance law. That's why Michael Cohen--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Then he has an obligation (ph)--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I'm not done.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: No, but let me - let me - I'm sorry--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: That's why Michael Cohen just pled guilty.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Let me ask you a question. Did they have an--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: That's why Michael Cohen just pled guilty.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I understand that.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I've been following the news as well.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Did Donald Trump have a moral obligation to tell the American people that he had a sexual relationship with Stormy Daniels?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I don't care whether he had a moral obligation--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Then that's why they probably didn't (ph)--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --what he had an obligation - no, what he had an obligation to do was not cover it up - cover it up and lie about it and commit campaign finance violations--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK. Oh, no (ph)--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --as his right-hand (ph) Michael Cohen just pled guilty to the felony, Tucker. What are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: All campaign (ph) finance violations?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Yes. Associated with--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --with Ms. McDougal and--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --I thought you were following the news. I thought you were--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So let me ask - let me ask you--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --knowledgeable about these things.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I'm a little confused.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I thought you were knowledgeable.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So you're - you're the protector of Stormy Daniels. Stormy Daniels is right now working in strip clubs in little towns on stage. People are throwing things at her. You're wearing a $1,000 suit. Why is you - why are you not paying her? You've profited from Stormy Daniels. You've done tens of millions dollars' worth of free media on the basis of your relationship with her and she's working in strip clubs. You're exploiting her, and you know that. Why aren't you paying her some of what you're making?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Sir, this is absurd. I have not exploited.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: It's not absurd. Those are the facts.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: No. You don't know the facts as evidenced by the fact that you don't even know--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Is she working in strip clubs?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Are you going to continue to interrupt me or you're going to let me finish?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I do know the facts, actually.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: All right, no, you don't because you just demonstrated your ignorance because you didn't even know Michael Cohen pled to two felonies associated with the campaign finance violations.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I don't believe that what Cohen did, and I'm not defending Cohen, I never have, was a campaign finance violation. I think it's absurd.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Well he pled to it. He pled to it.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I think it's absurd.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: He pled guilty to two felonies.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: OK. So, everyone who pleads - look, this is a--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: What? He's innocent?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --listen (ph) we have a - we have an honest disagreement - I don't think it was a campaign finance violation. Stormy Daniels was to perform in Richmond in a depressing strip club. This hero that you say you're protecting, you're her protector, why is she working in seedy strip clubs while you're on television wearing expensive suits?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Because--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Why are you not exploiting (ph) her? Why is she doing that?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Because she wants to, Tucker.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Oh, she wants to have people throw things at her in--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: This is America. This is America. And guess what, if a woman wants to perform in a strip club she does so even though--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: But you're getting richer, she's not.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --even though people - I'm not getting richer.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Of course, you are.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --even though people like you - even though people like you demean her--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I'm not demeaning her. You're the one--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --and call her--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --who's profiting--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You're the one that refers to her consistently as a porn star--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --and as to me as a creepy porn lawyer and meanwhile you give the President - meanwhile you give the President--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Well, well, well hold on - I would say--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --a pass to have unprotected sex with a porn star--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --with a four-month old son at home.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Well, you are a moralizer for a guy who would actually do (ph)--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: No, no, I'm - but I'm not - I'm not--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Oh, you are though. You are a little moralizer. You're like - we're in church now with a four-month old son, OK, I'm - I'm officially shocked by Donald Trump's behavior. I had no idea. It blew my mind. But answer my question. Why are you rich and your client--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Sir, I'm not--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --is working in seedy strip clubs?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Sir, do you have any idea how much money I've earned from this case?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: You're on every cable show.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You have no idea.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: You're running for president now.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You have no idea.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Well, I know that you haven't paid your taxes because you've got--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You haven't that (ph)--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --over a million dollars' worth of (ph)--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --that's absolutely ridiculous. You don't even know the facts.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: It's not true?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You don't even know your - you don't even know your facts, Tucker.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: You have over a million dollars in lease - look, I'm just saying why is she still--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Tucker, tucker, how do you have a show and you're this ignorant? How is that possible?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Here's what I know for a fact is that your client is not thriving. And for you to look at me in the eye and say she wants to perform in strip clubs with people throwing stuff at her is insulting to her, people don't do that unless they have no choice or she just likes it. Is that what you're saying?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Oh Tucker, now you're the defender of my client? You don't know anything about my--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: It's the fact that (ph) you're exploiting her.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --you don't even know - you don't know anything about my client. Exploiting my client - I've worked--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I know that she's working in a strip club in Richmond.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You got to let me finish. Can I finish?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Please do.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: All right. I've done a remarkable job for my client and she'll be the first one to tell you that. And had you listened to any of her interviews or seen--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --any of her comments you would know exactly what she thinks of me. I am not - I'm not done. I am not exploiting my client.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Right (ph).

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I'm representing my client to the absolute--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So when she wants to get you a little advise (ph)--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: I'm still talking - I'm still talking - I'm still talking

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --does she have to pretend to be a booker from CNN to get through to you?

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You know, that's - that's - that's disgusting. Why don't you show some respect?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: What's disgusting is--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Why don't you show some respect to my client--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --you are thriving and she is not.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --and me and stop calling us a porn star and a creepy porn lawyer. If you've got that big a problem with porn--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Well I actually thought--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --do you have that big a problem with porn?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --wait, wait, I'm not making fun of - hold on, slow down--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: When is the last time - when's the last - when's the last time you've saw porn?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Oh, you busted me. Actually maybe (ph) humiliation porn--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: That's why--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --that's why I watch you on CNN.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: No, no but when's the last time you've - when's the last time you've viewed - when's the last time you've viewed porn?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: You're a little creepier even than I realized--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Do you have a problem with it? Do you have a problem with porn?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: You're dodging the question--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: What's your problem with porn?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --that I have asked you repeatedly--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Let me ask you a question. Do you believe that people that view porn should watch your show?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I'm not even sure what that question means but I will say this--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Do you believe - do you--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --sincerely that I have never attacked Stormy Daniels.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: Yes, you have, repeatedly.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I think you are exploiting her as I've said five times--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: That's the truth.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --and you haven't answered the question which is--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: What's the question (ph)--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --why is it that her life has stalled and your life has - you're planning a new career as a politician. And like so many lawyers, you are taking advantage of her. And you pose as a feminist hero because you are shameless and the other channels let you get away with it. But you're an exploiter of a woman and you should be ashamed of it.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: And you're a--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: That is my - that is--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: No, are you going to let me finish and (ph) let me respond?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: No, we're out of time. And I gave you more time--

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You're a hypocrite. You're an absolute hypocrite.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --more time than I promised you.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: You're a hypocrite. And you don't know what you're talking about yet again--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: But it is nice to see you.

utterances.speaker: AVENATTI
utterances.utterance: --yet again.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: 12 minutes. Creepy porn lawyer, great to see you. Mark Steyn joins us after the break to react to that interview plus we'll have more on Hurricane Florence as it begins cutting its potentially deadly path through the Carolinas. Stay tuned.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: We just finished speaking to Stormy Daniels' attorney. During that interview, Mark Steyn was observing from the wings and he joins us now to assess. So, I guess what struck me about it, maybe it struck you, Mark--

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Yes (ph).

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: And I hate to attack people when they're out here, so I'm not really attacking. I'm just noting--

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: There was this undertone of moralizing like it's unbelievable that Trump would do this. It's betraying the country.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Either you get to be a libertarian on this stuff or you get to be an evangelical (ph) on it but you can't be both, can you?

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: No. And - and as you said, it's particularly absurd when his client, and I'm glad you mentioned her name because he's now far more famous than the client--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes, of course.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: --only in - only in - only in America, normally in sex scandals, the person having the sex becomes famous. And it's a sad comment on contemporary America--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: --that the lawyer representing the person having the sex is now more famous but as you said he's playing (ph)--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: That is so - let me just pause and say that is so deep and true what you just said.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Yes (ph).

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I'm printing it out and putting it on my fridge, that's totally right. Sorry, excuse me.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: No, no, no it's - it's - and she is playing seedy strip clubs.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: --the worst of the worst where you're standing on a narrow 18-inch bar while they're throwing dollar bills at you. And - and she's actually engaged in the same thing that this guy was doing on your show. They're both trying to figure out a way to monetize the case. And as you say, his way of monetizing the case is on - is in being on prime time TV shows. And you insulted him by saying it was a $1,000 suit. It's a $4,000 suit. That's how well he's living. She's on those strip club bars collecting those dollar bills because I take it--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: --even if he's on a pro bono basis, she's still having to pay all the so-called "costs." And - and that's--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: So then - then he says - so look, I don't even judge her in some ways because it's hard to make a living. I don't think you should be dancing in a strip club but I also know that people, you know, do things they shouldn't do because they're desperate. What infuriates me is when he- -

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --takes something as depressing as dancing in a strip club in Richmond or Bend, Oregon where she's having (ph) thrown at her--

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: --and says well that's her choice. That's empowerment as a feminist woman is - that's not empowerment. It's sad.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: No, no, this is - this is an evolution of the cliche. The cliche used to be that, you know, you're working in strip clubs to put yourself through law school. She's working in strip clubs to put her lawyer into the White House. She will - I said--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Ha ha--

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: --I said - I said when this whole thing started that the tragedy of this - he's basically a Category 5 hurricane porn lawyer, and she's like some spindly little clamored (ph) house on the beach that will be left busted, broken up in pieces--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: --and with nothing to show for this.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: That is - that is so true. In the end, the only ones who thrive are the lawyers, the parasites.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: And that is actually a metaphor for what's happening in this country more broadly. Shakespeare was right.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Right, right, right.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Boy, Mark, thank you very much for that.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Thank you. No further questions, your honor. That's how you're meant to wrap it up with him.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Unbelievable. Unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: You need a court stenographer to read back the questions.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Is there, really think, is there anything that I didn't ask that I should have asked that you would want to, I am not sure he's going to come back but if he does, that we should ask?

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: I was fascinated by his idea that 100 - a 100,000 troops on the Canadian border from Russia is something you need to prosecute according to law. Brilliant. We should have - we should have tried that with Pearl Harbor. Files - filed suit in Tokyo District Court. It would all have been over a lot quicker.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Extradition treaties, so good. Mark Steyn, it's always such a pleasure to have you here. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: STEYN
utterances.utterance: Thanks a lot, Tucker.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: By the way, Stormy Daniels' book comes out on October 2nd. I happen to know that because in one of those weird coincidences that happens, my book comes out the very same day. Daniels has written a tell- all, time to help Democrats in the mid-term elections, probably advised by her lawyer to do that. I've written a book about why powerful forces are promoting people like Stormy Daniels and creepy porn lawyer in the first place. The book is called Ship of Fools. And it's the story of how our political class manufactures sideshows like this to hide the fact that they have no idea what they're doing but are getting rich doing it. Two books, out the same day. If you want to send a message this might be the time. You can pre-order it if you want, just to make that message crystal-clear. We've got a Fox News Alert. Of course, the outer edge of Hurricane Florence now made contact with the coast of North Carolina bringing with it powerful winds, huge amounts of rain, and a storm surge that could be deadly. Our correspondent, Steve Harrigan is in North Topsail Beach, North Carolina, right in the path of this hurricane and he joins us tonight. Steve, what's it like?

utterances.speaker: STEVE HARRIGAN, CORRESPONDENT, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: Tucker, it's really gotten worse every hour. Right now, we're seeing sustained tropical storm force winds. A couple hours, we're probably going to see hurricane-force winds of over a 100 miles an hour. The rain is just coming down in sheets. It's actually blowing right into me. It's been like that for the last several hours. That's the real concern here is after the wind passes through we could see 30 or 40 inches of rain in some places. It was described in one weather - weather report as potential total inundation in parts of North Carolina, so that's the real fear. Most of the people are off this island. We just lost our own electric power a short time ago and it's just complete darkness all the way down this island (ph) and the people were well warned. They took those warnings seriously. Most of them have boarded up these houses here running (ph) the beach and left. So they're - they're for the large part gone but - but for those who stayed and know the risks there is going to be some help, some very brave first responders are prepared. There are Swift Boat (ph) rescue teams. There's - the National Guard's been called up, several thousand members and also the army is ready to save people as well with high water vehicles as well as helicopters. So this could be a really dicey and dangerous next 48 hours here along the coast of North Carolina. Tucker, back to you.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I believe it. Steve Harrigan who is always on the scene, no matter what, no matter where, thank you. Leland Vittert is in Morehead City, North Carolina for us tonight. Leland, what's it looking like?

utterances.speaker: LELAND VITTERT, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: Well, Tucker, the storm hit here a couple of hours before it hit Steve, so it has continually been a little bit stronger here and that is the real concern is these conditions have been going on for hours. Typically, in hurricanes, the really bad stuff only lasts a couple of hours. It could last 12 to 24 hours where we are. We've seen winds up to about 80 miles an hour, some gusts probably stronger than that. Again, power has been out here for now about six hours. Complete darkness. And you can see, as the tide has begun to come in we're getting the storm surge that is coming. Now it's actually much harder to stand than it ever has been here. This storm surge next couple of hours or so will lift these docks clear up, where I'm standing will be flooded and turn those docks into barges of destruction here throughout this town. Then, of course, comes the issue of inland flooding. We're going to be talking about hundreds of thousands, if not, millions of people without power and weeks to be able to restore it, Tucker.

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Be careful, Leland. Boy, you don't want to go over that edge at all. Good luck. Thank you. Stay with Fox News for continuing coverage of Hurricane Florence all night long and as long as it lasts. We'll see you tomorrow night on the show that's the sworn enemy of lying, pomposity, smugness, and groupthink. And trust me, we mean that with deepest sincerity. Good night from Washington. Sean Hannity live from New York City right now.

utterances.speaker: SEAN HANNITY, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: By the way, are you and Avenatti going on to dinner after that?

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: I don't know who that is. I -- I haven't heard, oh creepy porn lawyer? Yes, no, I don't think we are.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You guys -- looks like you guys going out for drinks, out to dinner, all right, Tucker, great show. Thanks for being--

utterances.speaker: CARLSON
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Thank you, Sean. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
